member.name: T:JetBrains.DocumentModel.DocColumn
member.summary: Type disambig for . Represents zero-based column indices in the document stream. This does not correspond directly to the text control view lines and columns because of the collapsed regions and other view transformations.

member.name: T:JetBrains.DocumentModel.DocLine
member.summary: Type disambig for . Represents zero-based line indices in the document stream. This does not correspond directly to the text control view lines and columns because of the collapsed regions and other view transformations.

summary.para: Denotes a change to the document text.

Possible changes are: characters inserted, characters deleted, characters replaced. All these are represented as replacements, eg deletion is replacing a range with an empty string, and insertion is replacing an empty range with some text.

member.name: T:JetBrains.DocumentModel.DocumentRangeMarkers
member.summary: RangeMarkers () associated with corresponding document (). Note, if a document is bound to a project file its range markers are stored in the project file so when the document is collected and a new one is created range markers survive.

member.name: T:JetBrains.DocumentModel.DocumentSyncMomentStatusManager
member.summary: For document implementations which are connected to a remote end and have a sync status with them, tells about this status on the back end. Sending ranges is only relevant on document revisions which will have a sync moment on the remote end.

member.summary: for all documents.

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.DocumentSyncMomentStatusManager.IsDocumentInSyncMoment(JetBrains.DocumentModel.IDocument)
member.summary: Gets whether the current revision of the document has or will have a sync moment with its remote counterpart. For document implementations without a remote counterpart, always True. Free-threaded. If you see a True value under a reader lock, it will hold until you release the lock.

member.summary: Like (in with-retry mode), with an extra condition that is True for your . Since reader lock is held, this will hold for the whole action. Check for interrupts as usual.

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.IDocument.GetCoordsByOffset(System.Int32)

summary.para: Gets document coordinates (line and column) by flat document offset.
The column number is forced within line length limits (inclusive) in case the offset falls on the line-break characters. In this case the offset/line-col might not roundtrip.

member.param: Offset in document, must be non-negative and less than or equal to document text length.

member.summary: Gets offset in document by document coordinates (line and column)
member.returns: offset in document, or -1 if coordinates are not within the document

member.summary: Gets the end offset of the given line. The possible line-break characters at the end of the line are included by this method.

summary.para: Gets the number of lines in the document.
This is the maximum possible line number (non-inclusive) for methods that take a line number.
A document has at least one line. An empty document has exactly one zero-length line.

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.IDocument.GetTextLength
member.summary: Gets the number of characters in the document. This is the maximum possible offset (inclusive) for methods that take an offset, including text ranges.

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.IDocument.EnsureWritable
member.summary: Use DocumentLineEndings.EnsureWritable wherever possible. Get clearance for write access to the document, for example, at the Source Code Control. You MUST scope document modifications with the return value of this method (dispose of the return value when done).
member.returns: The cookie that must be disposed of immediately after you're done with writing to the document. You're only allowed to write while it's alive and if its is .

summary.para: Represents a document without necessarily holding it in the memory. Can restore and return the document on demand.

member.name: F:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Impl.DocumentBase.myActionsToExecuteAfterChange
member.summary: Non-thread-safe init, changes are primary-thread-related only. Lazy: this field n/a when document is used from PSI for readonly background access.

member.name: F:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Impl.DocumentBase.myDocumentChangedEventDispatcher
member.summary: Lazy: this field n/a when document is used from PSI for readonly background access. Thread-safe init required: even though changes would only fire on the Write-Lock Thread, sometimes PSi would sink this event from secondary threads, eg on Generated Documents.

member.name: F:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Impl.DocumentBase.myBeforeDocumentChangedEventDispatcher
member.summary: Lazy: this field n/a when document is used from PSI for readonly background access. Thread-safe init required: even though changes would only fire on the Write-Lock Thread, sometimes PSi would sink this event from secondary threads, eg on Generated Documents.

member.name: F:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Impl.DocumentBase.myBeforeDocumentCopyChangedEventDispatcher
member.summary: Lazy: this field n/a when document is used from PSI for readonly background access. Thread-safe init required: even though changes would only fire on the Write-Lock Thread, sometimes PSi would sink this event from secondary threads, eg on Generated Documents.

member.name: F:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Impl.DocumentBase.myLineIndex
member.summary: Maps lines to their flat offsets. Lazy-inited when first requested. Free-threaded access, must be init-protected.

member.name: P:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Impl.DocumentBase.IsExpectingCallbacksFromUnderlyingStore
member.summary: For documents that are wrapping some underlying store (eg Visual Studio documents over Text Buffers), marks a state when we expect modification callbacks from the underlying store. This relaxes some limitations on document modifications, as those are actual changes to the underlying store we MUST apply to be in sync. The limitations include eg Modification Cookies that must be taken for all file-based documents on the Solution so that they could be cleared with SCC. These do not apply when the changes are coming from the underlying store.

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Impl.DocumentBase.ExpectCallbacksFromUnderlyingStore(System.Action)
member.summary: For documents that are wrapping some underlying store (eg Visual Studio documents over Text Buffers), marks a state when we expect modification callbacks from the underlying store. This relaxes some limitations on document modifications, as those are actual changes to the underlying store we MUST apply to be in sync. The limitations include eg Modification Cookies that must be taken for all file-based documents on the Solution so that they could be cleared with SCC. These do not apply when the changes are coming from the underlying store.

summary.para: Array-based implementation of line index.
Mapping between one-dimensional (offsets) to two-dimensional (lines and columns) coordinate systems.
This class is not thread-safe, the caller should take care of locking the read and write operations apart. This class has no implicit writes on reads.

member.summary: Id of a document open in the editor

member.name: F:JetBrains.DocumentModel.RunningDocumentId.Invalid
member.summary: Id of the not locked document

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.StandaloneDocument.MakeReadonly(JetBrains.Lifetimes.Lifetime,JetBrains.Util.TextRange)
member.summary: Locks a document range temporarily to prevent it from being edited. To unlock, dispose of the return value.

member.name: P:JetBrains.DocumentModel.StandaloneDocument.Moniker
member.summary: Gets the document moniker (an arbitrary string that helps with identifying this document).

member.name: T:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.EmptyDocumentStorageHelpers
member.summary: This is an empty implementation which can be factored within the Document Model zone solely. All functional implementations require the Project Model zone.

member.name: T:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers
member.summary: Helpers for to handle storing its content in some external media, such as disk files, Visual Studio Running Documents Table, or remote IDEA documents. This basic interface is not bound to project model or VS or anything and only operates on the document model. Implementations do have additional zoning requirements.

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers.SaveDocument(JetBrains.DocumentModel.IDocument)
member.summary: Saves the specified document

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers.GetUnsavedDocuments
member.summary: Returns all unsaved documents.

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers.IsDocumentUnsaved(JetBrains.DocumentModel.IDocument)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified document has not been saved since the last modification

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers.SaveAllDocuments
member.summary: Saves all documents

member.name: P:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers.AfterDocumentSaved
member.summary: Raised after a document has been saved.

member.name: P:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers.BeforeDocumentSaved
member.summary: Raised before a document has been saved. The handlers of this event are given a chance to cancel save.

member.name: P:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers.BeforeDocumentReloaded
member.summary: Raised before a document has been changed externally. The handlers of this event are given a chance to cancel the external change.

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers.SynchronizeDocumentContentsWithStorage(JetBrains.DocumentModel.IDocument,JetBrains.Util.VirtualFileSystemPath)
member.summary: Forces synchronizing the document with its content source. For standalone documents or VS documents not opened in the editor, these are external files. For open VS documents, this is the RDT document content. Requires a writer lock.

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Storage.IDocumentStorageHelpers.SynchronizeDocumentContentsWithDiskFile(JetBrains.DocumentModel.IDocument,JetBrains.Util.VirtualFileSystemPath)
member.summary: Implements the standalone case for . Forces disk file sync even if another storage is available.

member.name: T:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Transactions.DocumentModificationMap
member.summary: Converts series of sequential document changes to optimized final document change map

member.name: F:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Transactions.DocumentModificationMap.myMap
member.summary: Sorted

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Transactions.DocumentModificationMap.Finish(JetBrains.Text.IBuffer,JetBrains.Text.IBuffer)
member.summary: When all changes are consumed, make final optimization

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Transactions.DocumentModificationMap.FindStartPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Try to find the right segment in the modified document Returns true if the point is inside modified segment, and contains the segment index Returns false if the point is outside modified segment, and contains the previous segment index

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Transactions.DocumentModificationMap.FindEndPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Try to find the right segment in the modified document Returns true if the point is inside modified segment, and contains the segment index Returns false if the point is outside modified segment, and contains the next segment index

member.name: M:JetBrains.DocumentModel.Transactions.DocumentTransactionUtil.GetOptimizedChange(JetBrains.DocumentModel.DocumentChange,System.String)
member.summary: If the replaced text is the same at the beginning/ending, then do not modify that portion of text
